abstract: Transitions the video to a different experience.

declaration.code: @discardableResult @MainActor final func transition(to toExperience: AVExperienceController.Experience) async -> AVExperienceController.TransitionContext.TransitionResult

overview:
## Return Value

A transition result.

## Discussion

Call this method to transition to a different experience such as [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/Experience-swift.enum/expanded]. When you initiate a transition, the system calls the experience controller’s delegate methods so your app can respond to experience changes.

You determine the success of a transition by evaluating the [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/TransitionResult] this method returns. A transition result of [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/TransitionResult/completed] indicates a successful transition, in which case the system updates the [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/experience-swift.property] property to the new experience. A transition result of [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/TransitionResult/reversed(reason:)] indicates a failed transition. Evaluate the the result’s [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/ReversedReason] to determine why the transition failed. A failure that occurs before the transition begins results in the system not invoking any delegate callback methods. If the failure happens after the callback to  [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/Delegate-swift.protocol/experienceController(_:prepareForTransitionUsing:)] occurs, the transition context changes to [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/Status-swift.enum/finished(result:)].

# transition(to:)

**Instance Method**

Transitions the video to a different experience.

## Declaration

```swift
@discardableResult @MainActor final func transition(to toExperience: AVExperienceController.Experience) async -> AVExperienceController.TransitionContext.TransitionResult
```

## Parameters

- **toExperience**: The experience to transition to.

## Return Value

A transition result.

## Discussion

Call this method to transition to a different experience such as [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/Experience-swift.enum/expanded]. When you initiate a transition, the system calls the experience controller’s delegate methods so your app can respond to experience changes.

You determine the success of a transition by evaluating the [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/TransitionResult] this method returns. A transition result of [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/TransitionResult/completed] indicates a successful transition, in which case the system updates the [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/experience-swift.property] property to the new experience. A transition result of [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/TransitionResult/reversed(reason:)] indicates a failed transition. Evaluate the the result’s [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/ReversedReason] to determine why the transition failed. A failure that occurs before the transition begins results in the system not invoking any delegate callback methods. If the failure happens after the callback to  [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/Delegate-swift.protocol/experienceController(_:prepareForTransitionUsing:)] occurs, the transition context changes to [doc://com.apple.avkit/documentation/AVKit/AVExperienceController/TransitionContext/Status-swift.enum/finished(result:)].
